intro: Ricinus, commonly known as the castor oil plant, is a flowering plant native to the eastern and southern regions of Africa. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and spiky, reddish seed pods that contain toxic seeds. The plant is cultivated for its oil-rich seeds, which are used in various industrial and medicinal applications. Ricinus belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is known for its unique and striking appearance. Its growth habit includes both annual and perennial forms, depending on the climate and cultivation conditions.
